citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During inspection of vole enclosures on 9/11/23, veterinary medical officers noted that an animal that had undergone
surgery on 9/8/23 did not have the prescribed post operative monitoring documented on the surgical card as described in
the animal use protocol. The protocol states that, “post-procedure monitoring will be noted on the surgical card placed on
the front of the cage card for daily checks for at least 3 days.” The surgical card did not have the post procedural
monitoring documented for 9/10/23. Without this documentation, the condition of the animal is unknown, as is whether or
not the animal received additional analgesic medication that could have relieved unnecessary suffering, pain, and
distress. On 9/11/23, vole m338f was found deceased in the cage, and the resulting cause of death was noted to be due
to dehiscence of the surgical site, a described potential surgical complication noted within the approved animal use
protocol. Activities that involve surgery include appropriate provision for pre-operative and post-operative care of the
animals in accordance with established veterinary medical and nursing practices.
Correct by 14 September, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Attending Veterinarian & staff.
Additional Inspectors:
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
